posts.name: CardcaptorRLH85
posts.cooked:
Is it possible to run Shuffleboard across multiple screens?  One of our mentors purchased a small screen to connect to our operator station computer via HDMI for our camera output.  Is it possible to use Shuffleboard to put just the camera server output on that screen while still having the rest of the Shuffleboard on the laptop screen?

Right now, we’re using VLC on the other monitor and connecting directly to the video server (10.3.22.2:port-number) but, I’m not sure if that will work on a competition field.  No rush but, we have the second match tomorrow morning Thanks!

posts.name: James
posts.cooked:
As long as the port number is one of the ones allowed through from the robot to the driver station per the rules, then yes your VLC setup should work on the field as well IMG_20220331_235525 1080×875 125 KB

IMG_20220331_235525 1080×875 125 KB

IMG_20220331_235525 1080×875 125 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: No, Shuffleboard is single monitor.  Your solution of using VLC is fine, although I don’t know how well it handles automatic reconnection, and you won’t be able to easily tweak the stream resolution or compression if you’re using too much bandwidth–a better option might be to use SmartDashboard on the second monitor just to stream with.

posts.name: CardcaptorRLH85
posts.cooked: I’ve confirmed that we’re using port 1181 so that should be fine.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Suggestions for 2022 GradleRIO/VS Code changes Programming

posts.name: CardcaptorRLH85
posts.cooked: We’ve moved from VLC to a browser window in the second screen since it reconnects automatically when the robot connects to the operator station. We set the resolution and framerate programmatically to make sure that we’re below the limit.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: You could also use smartdashboard to display the camera feed.
